scene.name: intro
scene.line: Ah! So glad you stopped by. I've been standing here alone, waiting for my cast and crew, and I'm afraid very little can be done in their absence.
I've just been thinking. The narrow constraints of this space will make for quite an introspective stage. Even trying to visualize the performance here, I find my own thoughts drawn inward ...
Well, I suppose it is the business of a cast and crew to be late, just as it is the business of a director to visualize.
It's all becoming very clear to me. This venue will be perfect, a triumph ...
I wonder, do you ever feel as though you've arrived after ...
scene.option: I've been running late all day.

scene.name: late
scene.line: Exactly. Standing at the end of history, too late for masterpieces. Too late for an `Oresteia`, for a `Faustus`, for an `Iceman` ...

scene.name: after
scene.line: Just `after`, I suppose. After `Oresteia`. After `Faustus`. After `Iceman` ...
What's your most treasured stage production, my friend?

scene.name: glass-menagerie
scene.line: Oh? Tell me about it.
scene.option: They let us out of school to see it.

scene.name: gm-on-tv
scene.option: They all had lots of make-up, and the camera was too close so you could really see it caked on there.
I think they just pointed a camera at the stage and let it run.
It was playing in a bar with the sound off.

scene.name: make-up
scene.line: I suppose all tragedies become brittle and uncanny when viewed from the wrong distances ...

scene.name: pointed-a-camera
scene.line: The view from the peanut gallery!

scene.name: sound-off
scene.line: Well, I'm sure there was plenty of ambient tragedy to fill in the gaps.

scene.name: gm-on-stage
scene.option: We had to sit near the back, and I could only hear a few parts.

scene.name: sat-in-back
scene.line: What do you remember?
scene.option: They played this strange music through the whole thing.
They had a screen with words and pictures projected on it.

scene.name: plastic-theater
scene.line: Hm. Yes. Quite an experimental production, really — did you know? Plastic theater.

scene.name: fell-asleep
scene.line: Hm. Uncomfortable dreams, I can only guess ...

scene.name: never-seen-a-play
scene.line: Ah! Then let this be your first. I can't promise it will be an ideal introduction to the form — it is, as I say, an `experimental` production, conceived in response to the full history of the stage ...

scene.name: staging
scene.line: So, that said ... I have my vision for the transformation of this venue. But it's all still unsettled and potential, while we wait for the cast and crew to arrive.
So tell me, what do you think? Where in this cavernous storage facility shall we stage the production?
Where is there room for an audience to get that crucial dramatic distance from the performers?
scene.option: You could connect the audience and performers with a closed-circuit TV?

scene.name: no-audience
scene.line: How unorthodox ... an intimate performance, for the performers alone. And how lonely it would be — a theater of the dispossessed!

scene.name: closed-circuit
scene.line: Ah! Dramatic distance, indeed! It's certainly a modern take, and certainly within the realm of the possible ... In fact, we may be able to repurpose this facility's own security camera network!

scene.name: bye-for-now
scene.line: You've given me a great deal to think about, friends. And it seems I'll have some time yet to consider it all.
Well, surely the cast and crew will arrive within the hour, and we'll begin constructing the set and arranging the lights.
I hope you can come by again to see me before the show, but I understand you have your own tasks to carry out.
Just remember: `The Death of the Hired Man`! Random Access Storage Facility! Dawn!
